alert.note: Alert for Burleson; Washington (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 06 at 9:21PM CDT until April 08 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Houston/Galveston TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... Davidson Creek near Lyons affecting Washington and Burleson Counties. Middle Yegua Creek near Dime Box affecting Lee and Burleson Counties. For the Davidson Creek...including Lyons...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Davidson Creek near Lyons. * WHEN...From late tonight to Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding begins. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 11.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight to a crest of 16.3 feet late tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.3 feet on 05/14/2004. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (10 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Davidson Creek Lyons 16.0 11.3 Thu 9 pm CDT 15.8 14.9 12.6 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Friday morning at 930 AM CDT.
